Class FFMpeg

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.FFMpeg
public class FFMpeg extends Object
Convenience class to execute ffmpeg commands.

  • Method Details

    • execProcessWithResHandler

      public void execProcessWithResHandler(boolean withTimeout, long timeout, @NotNull @NotNull String workdir, @NotNull @NotNull org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteResultHandler resHandler) throws IOException
      This method executes a process given an instance of ExecuteResultHandler
      Parameters:
      withTimeout - A boolean parameter to tell if there is going to be a timeout
      timeout - The given timeout
      workdir - The working directory
      resHandler - The ExecuteResultHandler instance
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • executeCMD

      public void executeCMD(@NotNull @NotNull String workdir) throws IOException
      This method accomplishes the same goal as executeCMD(long, TimeUnit), but it does not set a time limit for the current thread to wait for the child process's termination. Use with caution. This method should be used only for those situations where the developer can be sure that the process will terminate in a reasonable time interval or where waiting for the child process is not a problem.
      Parameters:
      workdir - The working directory
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs

    • executeCMD

      public void executeCMD(long timeout, @NotNull @NotNull TimeUnit timeUnit, @NotNull @NotNull String workdir, @Nullable @Nullable org.apache.commons.exec.ExecuteResultHandler resHandler) throws IOException, InvalidArgumentException
      This method executes the given command on the ProcessBuilder instance on which this class has been instantiated.
      Parameters:
      timeout - The maximum time interval the calling process will wait for the child process to terminate.
      timeUnit - The TimeUnit instance that specifies the time unit associated to the first parameter.
      workdir - The chosen working directory.
      resHandler - The given ExecuteResultHandler instance. This value can be null.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given timeout is negative or the TimeUnit instance is null
